episode: I was furious when I saw the news on Republicans pushing tax cuts for the rich again.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Not too long ago, I saw in the news that Republicans were pushing tax cuts for the rich again.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That can be frustrating to hear.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I was furious. The Dems don't have control of House or Senate to stop the Republicans this time.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: I understand your frustration.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: While Trump is screwing everyone over with his tariffs that skyrocket input costs, Republicans are rewarding their wealthy backers.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: It's really upsetting.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Here are some specifics: "Nearly half the net benefit of extending the 2017 Trump tax cuts would go to the top 5 percent of households, or those making more than $450,000 a year. CBO estimates that permanently extending the 2017 tax law will cost $4.6 trillion (including net interest costs) over the decade."

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: That's really disheartening.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: What do you think can be done about this persistent issue?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Advocacy and voting for change.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: I don't think voting will stop this as elections are far away. They would have passed the tax cuts for the rich long before that happens.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Understandable concern.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Do you have any better solutions?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Public pressure and protest.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Public pressure doesn't seem to be doing much to change their ways. I also question the effectiveness of protests as such protests that happened so far had no effect.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Collaborate with advocacy groups.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: Which advocacy groups do you suggest for this?

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: Groups like Americans for Tax Fairness.

dialogue.speaker: Human
dialogue.message: How effective is this group at stopping tax cuts for the rich? Crooked Republicans seem to ram through tax cuts for the rich regardless.

dialogue.speaker: Bot
dialogue.message: They raise awareness and lobby.
